abstract: Review of studies published in journal Neurology finds young and middle-aged people with slightly elevated blood pressure are at much greater risk for stroke than those in normal range. Review's lead author is Dr Bruce Ovbiagele of University of California, San Diego.
snippet: Studies following people with prehypertension found that their risk of future stroke was 68 percent higher than those with normal blood pressure, a review suggested.
lead_paragraph: Studies following people with prehypertension found that their risk of future stroke was 68 percent higher than those with normal blood pressure, a review suggested.

headline.main: Prognosis: Slight Rise in Blood Pressure Carries Risk
headline.print_headline: Prognosis: Slight Rise in Blood Pressure Carries Risk
headline.seo: Even Slightly Elevated Blood Pressure Adds to Stroke Risk
